column4: what command can i use with apt-cache, or a similar command to see the files provided by a given package?
search only checks package names, it doesn't say what files are provided, so i can't find where it gets installed to
: i didnt get what you wanna do? you want to check which pkg's need to be installed also when installing a specific pkg? or where its installed too?
Hey.. which application allows me to add subtitles to a movie? (to play it together and also to create a new file with vid+subtitles)??
no i want th check what files get installed when i install a package, like where it puts its binaries and config files
: hmm.. i dont know how to check that.. i just know that usually u can find it in /usr/sbin /usr/share /sbin
how can i inject subtitles to a movie file??
its a web app, but nothing got added to /var/www roundcube
: you know which command runs the application?
thats why i need to find out what it installs, no command runs it, its web browser based
how can i inject subtitles to a movie file??
: whats the name of it? you cab find / -name <filename>
using find still won't tell me if it installed a file that doesn't have that name in it
did you try apt-cache search subtitle? a big list comes up for it, i've never tried any of them before though

: hmm im afraid i cant help you then, try googling for the same problem and see what the search produces, you can be amazed sometimes how a specific problem happens to another fraustrated buddy! and i didnt try it. cause i wanted to see which is recomended instead of trying them all before :) but thanks i think ill do that after all :)
